intro: Cephalanthera longifolia var. pilosa, commonly known as the hairy long-leaved杓兰, is a species of orchid native to parts of Asia, particularly China. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pale yellow. The leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in a fine, hairy texture, which gives the variety its common name. This orchid thrives in shaded, moist environments, often in forest understories. It is a perennial plant that produces flowers in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators with its fragrant blooms.
